question.body: Which of the following hormones is involved in short-term stress?

response.feedback: Incorrect. This tropic hormone from anterior pituitary controls release of corticosteroids from adrenal cortex involved in chronic stress.
Incorrect. These include glucocorticoid and mineralcorticoid hormones from the adrenal cortex involved in chronic stress.
Correct. This includes epinephrine and norepinephrine from the adrenal medulla.
Incorrect. This is a corticosteroid glucocorticoid hormone that is involved in chronic stress.

part.hint: It also comes directly from the sympathetic nervous system responding to immediate danger.
